problem.markdown:
1. Soil water content is expressed on what basis () Gravimetric () volumetric (x) Both a and b () None
2) Water content affects (x) Strength and settlement of soils () Sensitivity () Relative dendity () None
3) The water content of clays are generally ________ sand and silts (x) Greater than () Equal to () Less than () None
4) The standard method of determining water content is (x) Oven-drying method () Calcium carbide method () Alcohol method () Pycnometer method
5) Pycnometer is used to determined () Water content and void ratio () Specific gravity and dry density (x) Water content and specific gravity () Void ratio and dry density
6) The water content of soil is defined as the ratio of () Volume of water to volume of given soil () Volume of water to volume of voids in soil () Weight of water to weight of air voids (x) Weight of water to weight of solids of given mass of soil
7) Water content of a soil sample is the difference of weight of given sample at the temperature and the weight determined after drying it for 24hrs at temperature ranging from ⁰c () 80⁰ c to 90⁰c () 90⁰c to 95⁰c () 95⁰c to 100⁰c (x) 105⁰c to 110⁰c
8) The ratio of the weight of given volume of soil solids to the weight of an equal of distilled water at the given temperature, is known () Porosity (x) Specific gravity () Void ratio () Water content
problem.p: 1. Soil water content is expressed on what basis

6) The water content of soil is defined as the ratio of

choicegroup.choice: Volume of water to volume of given soil
Volume of water to volume of voids in soil
Weight of water to weight of air voids
Weight of water to weight of solids of given mass of soil
